short_summary: Correctional Service of Canada wishes to enter into an advanced contract award notice to procure Elder Helper Services as per the term of Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) requirements. CSC requires that Indigenous offenders have the opportunity to further develop their understanding of traditional Indigenous spirituality while allowing non-Indigenous offenders to practice their beliefs and values systems.
description:
An advanced contract award notice (ACAN) is a public notice indicating to the supplier community that a department or agency intends to award a contract for goods, services or construction to a pre-identified supplier, thereby allowing other suppliers to signal their interest in bidding, by submitting a statement of capabilities.

1. Definition of the requirement: The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) has a requirement to provide Elder programming to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders. The Elder Helpers must be available to assist and supplement the work of Elders, thus enhancing Indigenous programming. CSC is legislated to provide Indigenous offenders with the opportunity to further develop their understanding of traditional Indigenous spirituality while allowing non-Indigenous offenders to practice their beliefs and values systems.

1.1 Objectives: As required by the CCRA and individual correctional plans, Elder Helpers are engaged to ensure the accommodation of Indigenous spiritual and cultural practices. They assist the Elders in supporting Indigenous offenders on their traditional healing journey, to further develop an understanding of traditional Indigenous culture through teachings, guidance and counselling. Further, they utilize traditional ceremonies and practices, where they have been given the responsibility to assist the work of Elders, to promote healing and balance.

1.2 Tasks: The Elder Helper must provide the following services: Ensure offenders and staff approach the Elder providing service according to proper traditional protocol. Ensure an adequate supply of traditional ceremonial material is on hand in order to ensure the ceremonial aspect of the work is maintained. Coordinate and provide supervision for offenders during traditional ceremonies; with the Elder’s agreement, perform traditional ceremonies in the absence of the Elder (including but not limited to, pipe ceremony, sweat lodge ceremony and sharing circles). Conduct group discussions and teachings, with the Elder’s agreement, in the identification and proper use of ceremonial objects for offenders and staff. Assist staff to prepare reports (verbal and written) and provide other technical support for case management and parole processes. Provide counselling services to offenders as directed when the Elder is unavailable. Assist in scheduling ceremonies and provide written notification of these events to appropriate Elders and staff. Provide a list of contacts with offenders, activities and ceremonies attended to the Project Authority or their designate. Participate in staff meetings to further enhance team concept and to create and maintain a healthy support network. Participate in meetings with staff to facilitate communication and cooperation with the Elder. Provide cultural awareness sessions in traditional teachings and healing to Case Management Team members and institutional staff in order to promote a culturally safe environment for Indigenous offenders.

1.3 Expected Results: Provision of Indigenous programming and Elder Helper services to the Indigenous offender population.

### Elder Helper Services Tender Announcement

#### Tender Number and Title

*   Tender Number: PW-22-01018824
*   Tender Title: Elder Helper Services

#### Tender Information

*   Publication Date: 2022-12-27
*   Tender Closing Date: 2023-01-13T15:00:00
*   Amendatory Notice (0) is issued.
*   The tender is not governed by a trade agreement.

#### Tender Description

A public tender is called for the provision of Elder Helper Services to the Correctional Service of Canada (CSC). The CSC must provide programmes to facilitate the spiritual and cultural development of Indigenous offenders. The tender seeks a qualified supplier to provide services that promote traditional healing and support the well-being of Indigenous offenders.

Key responsibilities of the supplier:

*   Assist Indigenous offenders in federal institutions to benefit from traditional healing and contemporary treatment interventions
*   Ensure offenders and staff approach the Elder providing service according to proper traditional protocol
*   Assist staff in preparing reports and providing technical support for case management and parole processes
*   Provide counselling services to offenders when the Elder is unavailable
*   Assist in scheduling ceremonies and provide written notification of these events to appropriate Elders and staff
*   Provide a list of contacts with offenders and activities attended to the Project Authority or their designate

#### Invitation to Tender

The Correctional Service of Canada invites interested suppliers to submit an expression of interest through a Statement of Capabilities (SoC). (Please note that this invitation to tender supersedes any previous notices or advertisements issued)

A SoC must clearly demonstrate how the supplier meets the advertised requirements. It must outline the supplier’s experience, qualifications, and approach to delivering the services that meet the requirements set out in this tender.

#### Submittal Requirements

Preference may be given to statements of capabilities from Indigenous suppliers. Interested suppliers must submit their statements by January 13th, 2023 at 14:00 CST.

Questions or concerns regarding this tender can be directed to Janet Nelson, Regional Procurement Officer at (306) 659-9300 or via email at: 501contracts@csc-scc.gc.ca

#### Items to Note

*   This (full notice of this procurement) is issued in accordance with the federal government's procurement policies.
*   The Correctional Service of Canada reserves the right to amend this notice and/or cancel this tender at any time without obligation.
*   Debarment and post-qualification monitoring procedures are subject to applicable federal laws
